page.title: 17Whitewell's Farm Cottages
page.content: Between 1978 and 1984 the old farm buildings were converted into seven luxurious{self catering cottages,}each with its own individual character. The hop kiln has circular rooms, and all the cottages have exposed beams. Lying on the A4103 it forms a good base for exploring both the{Welsh {Borderland}and the{Severn Valley.} It is open all the year. A cottage costs about Â£80 a week in winter and up to Â£225 in summer. So far the scheme has been very successful and the cottages are fully booked. Although many guests are british, there are also {foreign tourists,}especially americans, africans and australians. Most of the guests have been either elderly people or couples with young children who want a quiet holiday centre. They shop locally for food at Ridgeway Cross and Cradley.
